messageBody:
On Sat, 24 Nov 2001, Bhanu Prakash,ilabs ltd wrote:

> hi friends
> just i have a small things to ask
> 1) how to test private methods

One thing I've found successfull is to make an inner class my test object,
like:

public class Foo { // The class I'm going to test
private int doit() { ... } // The function I'm going to test

private class MyTestClass extends junit.framework.TestCase {
public void testDoit() {
assertTrue(doit() == 3); // Make sure doit works correctly
}
}

public static junit.framework.Test suite() {
junit.framework.Test retval = new junit.framework.Test();
retval.addTest(new MyTestClass("testDoit"));
}
}

The inner class (MyTestClass) can now see the private doit() function to
test it.

> 2) how to catch test result and store in the file. please if any body
> have the program please send me as attachment.

Short answer: redirect stdout and stderr into a file.

I'm using bash and make on a unix box. I just do:
$ make run 2>&1 | tee make.res

Of course, I'm using the text interface, not the fancy GUI interface. One
of the advantages of doing so...

Brian
